newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil talking with agronomists on coffee estimate.
newsitem.headline: Brazil talking with agronomists on coffee estimate.

text.p: Brazilian coffee agronomists have been meeting with government officials to discuss the viability of an official estimate of the 1997/98 crop which could be available in November, an agronomist said.
"The will is certainly there to have an estimate, the only thing that is missing is the money," said Jose Matiello, co-ordinator of the Agriculture Ministry's Procafe department.
Around 90,000 reais ($91,800) is needed for a comprehensive and scientific survey of farmers in producing states, he said.
Everything is in place for a survey to be carried out in the coming weeks and Matiello believed that an estimate could be available as early as next month.
"I believe something will come out in November," he said.

Matiello, who recently co-ordinated two profiles of coffee production in the states of Minas Gerais and Bahia, has already said he expects the 1997/98 crop to be below that of 1995/96 which he estimated at 23 million to 24 million 60-kg bags.
Recent trips to Minas Gerais and Espirito Santo have not caused him to change his mind.
"I am maintaining the same expectations....Conditions in Minas Gerais and Espirito Santo are certainly unfavorable compared with last year," he said.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
